column4: is there any partitioning tool that can make ext3 partition on ntfs formatted disk ?? I dont want to use whole disk so thats a bit tricy
*tricky
when you install Ubuntu, it will automatically resize your ntfs partition and set up an ext3 one.
it's the sensible choice, given that most graphics hardware won't display more, even in 32bit mod
I have a problem switching workspaces when playing warcraft in wine and in the output it says something about color depth
and aint 32bit display mode normal from long time ago ?
no
32bit has always been more of a pseudo-mode that resulted in 24bit displays anyway
ok. then something else must be a problem
if you have graphics-switching related problems, I would try switching down to 16 rather than up to 32
yeah but game works in 32bit. maybe I'll try 16 just for a change
by all means, try it all out. Just add a line    DefaultDepth 32   in /etc/X11/xorg.conf , section Screen
do you wanna check out my console output ?? I have it on pastebin   http://www.pastebin.org/37078
doesn't mean much to me, sorry. Can't see anything colordepth-related, either
well people at winehq channel arent much of a hep
'sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop'
then choose a KDE session from the login window
are you on hardy?
yep
run 'apt-cache policy firefox-3.0' to find out your  current version (marked ***). If it's still beta, do a 'sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade'
thanks. I'm on it
